body: Though Brooklynites identify themselves pretty closely with their neighborhoods, many areas are so big and varied that those designations cannot mean much. But say you live in the Prospect-Lefferts Gardens Historic District, just east of Prospect Park, and you are saying that you almost certainly live in a single-family house, on a tranquil,
title: LOCAL STOP | PROSPECT-LEFFERTS GARDENS; Brownstones and Rastafarian Gear

body: The morning after his mother was killed in Brooklyn, Chinnarie Gordon, 5, took his grandmother's hand and walked to Parkside Playground. As his cousins played in the fountains, Chinnarie climbed up to a checkers table and began drawing a picture of his mother in blue chalk, giving her long blue hair and a mermaid's tail. title: A Killing on a Brooklyn Block Known for Its Violence

body: IT took a while for Athanasios Biros to solve the mystery of his noisy upstairs neighbor. Mr. Biros, 35, who works for a bank, at first suspected a bartender with odd working hours lived above his studio in Greenwich Village. Then he heard a pounding noise at 7 in the morning. ''I just snapped,'' he said. He knocked on the door, and met his
title: Sleepwalk to Work

body: C. B. Bucknor, 50, was a physical therapist at what was then New York Hospital-Cornell Medical Center when, on a whim, he used vacation time to attend umpire school in 1990. A career change ensued. Now, most of his Sundays involve ballgames and airline travel; he umpires 135 Major League games a season, not counting spring training and the
title: SUNDAY ROUTINE | C. B. BUCKNOR; Balls, Strikes and Noodle Pudding

body: EVERY year, spring brings with it the promise of new planting, home improvement projects and renovations. Those in search of inspiration can find it in the houses and gardens open to the public across the country. Most tours are self-guided, unless otherwise noted. body: Inside the fencing proclaiming ''Lakeside is for you'' at the southeastern end of Prospect Park, tractors sat beneath a canopy covering a future outdoor hockey rink. Beside it, a second rink was outlined like an oval pond, as ice-making equipment slept under plastic in a nearby building. Saplings basked in the sun where workers had already left one
title: At Prospect Park, A Transformation Is Behind Schedule
